pullRequest.title: Handle OData property types
pullRequest.bodyText:
Creates a mapping of OData types to:
1.) The Java types that should cause the OData type annotation to be applied, and
2.) A function that knows how to parse a string value that has such an annotation into a Java type
Updates the deserializer to consult this mapping when deserializing, and updates the serializer to inspect the value's type and add an OData type annotation if applicable.
Fixes: #14596

nodes.bodyText: I think the convention is valueOf

This type can describe a + * numeric value ranging from negative 10^255 + 1 to positive 10^255 -1 + */ + DECIMAL("Edm.Decimal", Collections.singleton(BigDecimal.class), BigDecimal::new), + + /** + * Edm.Double Represents a floating point number with 15 digits precision that can represent values + * with approximate range of +/- 2.23e -308 through +/- 1.79e +308 + */ + DOUBLE("Edm.Double", Stream.of(double.class, Double.class), Double::parseDouble), + + /** + * Edm.Single Represents a floating point number with 7 digits precision that can represent values + * with approximate range of +/- 1.18e -38 through +/- 3.40e +38 + */ + SINGLE("Edm.Single", Stream.of(float.class, Float.class), Float::parseFloat), + + /** + * Edm.Guid Represents a 16-byte (128-bit) unique identifier value + */ + GUID("Edm.Guid", Collections.singleton(UUID.class), UUID::fromString), + + /** + * Edm.Int16 Represents a signed 16-bit integer value + */ + INT16("Edm.Int16", Stream.of(short.class, Short.class), Short::parseShort), + + /** + * Edm.Int32 Represents a signed 32-bit integer value + */ + INT32("Edm.Int32", Stream.of(int.class, Integer.class), Integer::parseInt), + + /** + * Edm.Int64 Represents a signed 64-bit integer value + */ + INT64("Edm.Int64", Stream.of(long.class, Long.class), Long::parseLong), + + /** + * Edm.SByte Represents a signed 8-bit integer value + */ + SBYTE("Edm.SByte", Stream.of(byte.class, Byte.class), Byte::parseByte), + + /** + * Edm.String Represents fixed- or variable-length character data + */ + STRING("Edm.String", Collections.singleton(String.class), s -> s), + + /** + * Edm.Time Represents the time of day with values ranging from 0:00:00.x to 23:59:59.y, where x + * and y depend upon the precision + */ + TIME("Edm.Time", Stream.of(LocalTime.class, OffsetTime.class), s -> + DateTimeFormatter.ISO_DATE_TIME.parseBest(s, OffsetTime::from, LocalTime::from) + ); + + private final String edmType; + private final Set> serializeFrom; + private final Function deserializer; + + EntityDataModelType(String edmType, Set> serializeFrom, Function deserializer) { + this.edmType = edmType; + this.serializeFrom = serializeFrom; + this.deserializer = deserializer; + } + + EntityDataModelType(String edmType, Stream> serializeFrom, Function deserializer) { + this(edmType, (Set>) serializeFrom.collect(Collectors.toCollection(HashSet::new)), deserializer); nodes.bodyText: I think this can be made static. It doesn't rely on any state in the class, iirc.i
Does that mean we can just delete the other serializer now?

commit.message: Insert OData metadata properties when serializing
